p: COVID-19 caused by SARS-CoV-2, formerly 2019 novel coronavirus or 2019-nCoV [ 1], broke out in Wuhan, China in December 2019 [ 2]. Epidemics of COVID-19 are now occurring worldwide [ 3]. Since the first COVID-19 case in Wuhan was identified on 12 December 2019, in less than 4 months (1 April 2020), the number of cumulative confirmed cases in the world has exceeded 800,000 [ 4, 5]. On 30 January 2020, the outbreak was declared an international public health emergency by the World Health Organization (WHO) [ 6].
